air: Contrary to the name of this website, air can't be spawned as an item in your inventory. It is used as a block to represent, well, air! It can't be seen and is non-solid (so you can walk through it).
stone: Below is a table of the tools that can be used to break Stone blocks, and the speed it will take to break at (in seconds). This is calculated with the formula (1.5 * Block Hardness) / Tool Multiplier.

Stone, not to be confused with cobblestone, can only be obtained when a stoneblock is broken with a silk touch pickaxe. It is required for many redstone items such as the comparator, and decorative items like stonebricks.

bedrock: Bedrock cannot be obtained in Vanilla Minecraft. It covers the lowest point of the world to prevent people from falling in the void. It cannot be broken in survival mode.
sand: Below is a table of the tools that can be used to break Sand blocks, and the speed it will take to break at (in seconds). This is calculated with the formula (1.5 * Block Hardness) / Tool Multiplier.

Sand is found in the desert and near the ocean/rivers. It is used to make glass (by smelting it in a furnace). It is also one of the few blocks to respond to gravity - if it does not have a supprting block underneath it, it will fall to the ground.
red-sand: Below is a table of the tools that can be used to break Red Sand blocks, and the speed it will take to break at (in seconds). This is calculated with the formula (1.5 * Block Hardness) / Tool Multiplier.
Red sand is very similar to regular sand. The only differences between red sand and regular sand are the textures, and red sand's inability to be used to craft concrete.
gravel: Below is a table of the tools that can be used to break Gravel blocks, and the speed it will take to break at (in seconds). This is calculated with the formula (1.5 * Block Hardness) / Tool Multiplier.

Gravel, like sand, is one of the few blocks in Minecraft that responds to gravity. Despite being in the game for a long time, its only real use is to make concrete. It can also be traded with villagers for emeralds.
gold-ore: Below is a table of the tools that can be used to break Gold Ore blocks, and the speed it will take to break at (in seconds). This is calculated with the formula (1.5 * Block Hardness) / Tool Multiplier.
Gold ore can be smelted in a furnace to make golden ingots. Before it has been smelted, it does not much use. It is about five times rarer than iron ore, and only spawns below Y 32.
iron-ore: Below is a table of the tools that can be used to break Iron Ore blocks, and the speed it will take to break at (in seconds). This is calculated with the formula (1.5 * Block Hardness) / Tool Multiplier.
Iron ore, similar to gold ore, can be smelted in a furnace to make iron ingots. Before it has been smelted, it does not much use.
coal-ore: Below is a table of the tools that can be used to break Coal Ore blocks, and the speed it will take to break at (in seconds). This is calculated with the formula (1.5 * Block Hardness) / Tool Multiplier.
This block can only be obtained when it is mined with a pickaxe that has the silk touch enchantment. When mined, it drops coal, which can be used as a fuel in a furnace.

sponge: Sponge can be used to soak up water in Minecraft. Whilst an unsoaked sponge cannot be obtained in Vanilla Minecraft, placing a wet sponge in a furnace yields this block (which can then be used to soak up water).
wet-sponge: Wet sponges can be obtained from ocean monuments and are dropped by elder guardians upon death. They are also formed when a sponge becomes fully soaked. To obtain a regular sponge from a wet sponge, the wet sponge must be placedin a furnace (with appropriate fuel).
glass: Glass is obtained when sand is smelted in a furnace. When broken without a silk touch pickaxe, it does not yield the glass block. It is a transparent block, and used in crafting recipes for beacons, stained glass, daylight sensors, glass bottles, end crystals and various other items.

The command block in Minecraft can be used to execute commands. They cannot be obtained in Vanilla MC but, by using the item id, you can spawn the command block item into your inventory when in creative mode. In many cases, you must be a server op to use the block. Modifiers such as @p and @e can be used to target things like players and entities with commands.

turtle-shell: This item can be crafted by placing 5 scutes in a crafting table (in a helmet shape). It will give the wielder the water breathing potion effect when worn underwater.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Turtle Shell.
scute: Scutes are dropped by baby turtles when they grow into adults. They are used to craft turtle shell helmets.
iron-shovel: Iron shovels require 1 iron ingot to craft. They can break dirt, sand, gravel and other similar blocks at a faster rate than lower-level shovels.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Iron Shovel.
iron-pickaxe: Iron pickaxes require 3 iron ingots to craft. They are required to mine diamonds, and mine other blocks like stone, cobblestone, and ores at a faster rate than lower-level pickaxes.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Iron Pickaxe.
iron-axe: Iron axes (hatchet) are used to cut wooden items like planks, logs, slabs, etc rate at a faster rate. They require 3 iron ingots to craft.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Iron Axe.
flint-and-steel: Flint and steel can be made with flint and iron. The item is used to create fire in Minecraft, by right clicking a block.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Flint and Steel.
apple: Apples can be eaten, or used to create golden apples and notch/god apples. Apples have a 1 in 200 chance of being dropped when leaves decay, or are broken.
bow: Bows are used to shoot arrows in Minecraft. When the arrow hits an entity, it causes damage. They are also required to make dispensers.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Bow.
arrow: Arrows are used as ammunition for bows. They can also be used in dispensers. When they collide with a damageable mob/entity, they cause damage. They can also activate things like pressure plates.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Arrow.
coal: Coal is obtained when coal ore is mined in Minecraft. Coal can be used to create coal blocks, or as a fuel in a furnace to smelt items.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Coal.
charcoal: Charcoal in Minecraft is used as a fuel, just like regular coal. It could be considered superior can be made with logs, so you do not need to mine coal to use it as a fuel.
diamond: Diamonds are perhaps Minecraft's most famous item. They can be used to make diamond armour, weapons and tools - as well as blocks like enchantment tables. They are obtained when diamond ore is mined.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Diamond.
iron-ingot: Iron ingots are obtained when iron ore is smelted with fuel in a furnace. Iron ingots are an essential ingredient in many crafting recipes including iron tools, weapons and armour - along with things like iron doors and anvils.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Iron Ingot.
gold-ingot: Golden ingots are obtained when gold ore is smelted with fuel in a furnace. They can be converted into golden nuggets, or used to create golden armour, tools and weapons. Golden ingots can also be used to make golden apples and are used in other crafting recipes.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Gold Ingot.
iron-sword: Iron swords can be crafted using two iron ingots and a stick in Minecraft. They deal more damage to mobs and other entities than lower-leveled swords and weapons.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Iron Sword.
wooden-sword: Wood swords in Minecraft can be crafted using 2 wooden planks and 1 wooden stick. They are the least powerful sword, but still deal more damage to mobs and entities than your bare hands would, and can be enchanted.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Wooden Sword.
wooden-shovel: Wood shovels in Minecraft can be crafted using 2 wooden sticks and 1 wooden plank. Whilst wooden tools are the weakest of all tools in Minecraft, this will still break dirt, sand, gravel, etc faster than your bare hands.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Wooden Shovel.
wooden-pickaxe: Wood pickaxes in Minecraft can be crafted using 2 wooden sticks and 3 wooden planks. Whilst wooden tools are the weakest of all tools in Minecraft, this will still mine stone, cobblestone, etc faster than your bare hands.

wooden-axe: Wood axes (hatchet) in Minecraft can be crafted using 2 wooden sticks and 3 wooden planks. Whilst wooden tools are the weakest of all tools in Minecraft, this will still break wooden blocks and logs faster than your bare hands.

stone-sword: Stone swords are the 2nd least powerful swords in Minecraft. They are easy to make: 1 stick and 2 cobblestone is required and deal a considerable amount of damage to mobs and other entities.

stone-shovel: Stone shovels can be crafted using 2 wooden sticks and 1 cobblestone/stone block. Whilst stone tools are the 2nd weakest tool in Minecraft, they are a massive step up from wooden tools in both durability and the time they take to break blocks.

raw-porkchop: Raw porkchop is dropped from pigs in Minecraft when they are killed (and not on fire). It can be cooked in a furnace to form cooked porkchop, which is a food item.
cooked-porkchop: Cooked porkchop can be made by killing a pig whilst it is on fire, or by cooking raw porkchop in a furnace. When eaten, this item satiates your hunger.
painting: Paintings are items in Minecraft that display a piece of artwork. The piece of art shown is random.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Painting.
golden-apple: Golden apples in Minecraft provide absorption, 2 hunger levels and the regeneration potion effect when consumed. They can be made with 8 golden ingots and 1 apple.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Golden Apple.
enchanted-golden-apple: The enchanted golden apple, also known as the god apple, notch apple, or OP apple in Minecraft is an item that require 8 golden blocks and 1 apple to craft. It provides 30 seconds of regeneration, 2 minutes of absorption and 5 minutes of both resistance and fire resistance when consumed.

bucket: A bucket is made with 3 iron ingots. It can be filled with water or lava by right clicking on a water or lava source.

water-bucket: A water bucket can be obtained by right clicking a bucket on a water source. Water buckets are useful for moving water.
lava-bucket: A lava bucket can be obtained by right clicking a bucket on a lava source. Lava buckets are useful for moving lava.
minecart: A minecart can be made using 5 iron ingots. It is primarily a transportation item that can be used to move quickly across mine tracks. It also can be used to make things like hopper minecarts, which are useful for redstone circuits.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Minecart.
saddle: A saddle can be placed on a pig, horse, or any other rideable mob to.. ride it! This is useful as riding on mobs like horses is faster than sprinting!
redstone: Redstone dust is an essential item for redstone circuits. A random number of redstone is dropped when redstone ore is broken. Redstone is also used in many different crafting recipes.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Redstone.
snowball: Snowballs are obtained when snow is broken with any shovel. They can be thrown by right clicking them.
oak-boat: Oak boats are useful as they allow fast transport across water. They can be made with 5 oak planks, and put on water by right click.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Oak Boat.
leather: A random amount of leather is dropped when cows are killed. Leather can be used to create leather armor, and is an essential ingredient in many other crafting recipes.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Leather.
milk-bucket: Buckets of milk can be obtained by right clicking a cow with an empty bucket. They are required to make cakes.
bucket-of-pufferfish: This item can be obtained by using any water bucket on a pufferfish mob (as of 1.13). You can then right click this item anywhere in the world to place the water in the bucket with the fish within - making it a useful item from transporting fish.
bucket-of-salmon: This item can be obtained by using any water bucket on a salmon mob (as of 1.13). You can then right click this item anywhere in the world to place the water in the bucket with the fish within - making it a useful item from transporting fish.
bucket-of-cod: This item can be obtained by using any water bucket on a cod mob (as of 1.13). You can then right click this item anywhere in the world to place the water in the bucket with the fish within - making it a useful item from transporting fish.
bucket-of-tropical-fish: This item can be obtained by using any water bucket on a tropical fish mob (as of 1.13). You can then right click this item anywhere in the world to place the water in the bucket with the fish within - making it a useful item from transporting fish.
brick: Bricks in Minecraft can be made by smelting clay in a furnace. They are used to create flower pots and bricks (block).

paper: Paper can be made by placing 3 sugar cane in a vertical line in the crafting bench. It is used to create maps, books and fireworks.

book: Books in Minecraft can be made with 3 paper and 1 piece of leather. They are required to make enchantment tables, bookshelves and the book and quill item.

minecart-with-furnace: Minecarts with furnaces are, as the name would suggest, minecarts with furnaces inside. They cannot take a passenger. When right clicked, they open up the furnace interface to smelt and cook items.

egg: Eggs in Minecraft are dropped by chickens (naturally, not when killed). When right clicked, they are thrown like snowballs and have a 1 in 8 chance of spawning a baby chicken. Eggs are also used to create cakes and pumpkin pies in Minecraft.
compass: Unlike real-life compasses, Minecraft compasses point to the world spawn point. They are useful for navigation. In the nether and end, the item does not work.

fishing-rod: Fishing rods can be made with 3 sticks and 2 pieces of string. When right clicked, they will cast a line. They can be used to fish, but there is a rare chance of finding other items. Carrots can also be added to the end of fishing rods, which can be used to move pigs around.

clock: Clocks in Minecraft can be used to tell the time of day.. it'd probably be easier to just look outside!

glowstone-dust: Glowstone dust is dropped in random amounts when glowstone is broken. It is used as a brewing ingredient, and also in some crafting recipes such as the glowstone block.
raw-cod: Raw fish, also known as raw cod, in Minecraft can be obtained by fishing with a fishing rod. It can be cooked in a furnace.
raw-salmon: Raw salmon in Minecraft can be obtained by fishing with a fishing rod. It can be cooked in a furnace.
tropical-fish: Clownfish in Minecraft can be obtained by fishing with a fishing rod. It can be cooked in a furnace.
pufferfish: Pufferfish in Minecraft can be obtained by fishing with a fishing rod. It can be cooked in a furnace.
cooked-cod: Cooked fish, also known as cooked cod, can be obtained by cooking a raw fish in a furnace in Minecraft.
cooked-salmon: Cooked salmon can be obtained by cooking a raw salmon in a furnace in Minecraft.
ink-sac: Ink sacs can be obtained by killing squid in Minecraft. They are the darkest form of dye.

cookie: Cookies can be made using 2 wheat and 1 cocoa beans. It is a cheap and simple form of food that restores 2 hunger.

map: Maps (filled) in Minecraft can be used to get a birds eye view of the world and find your way about. They can be made using 9 paper.
shears: Shears can be made using 2 iron ingots. They can be used to shear sheep (to obtain wool) and destroy leaves at an accelerated rate.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Shears.
melon-slice: The melon item in Minecraft is dropped when the melon block is broken without a silk touch enchented item. It is a food and restores hunger levels when consumed.
dried-kelp: Dried kelp is created when regular kelp is smelted in a furnace. It can be consumed or used to create dry kelp blocks.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Dried Kelp.
pumpkin-seeds: Pumpkin seeds can be planted on hoed land in Minecraft. Under the right conditions, the seeds will grow into a pumpkin block.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Pumpkin Seeds.
melon-seeds: Melon seeds can be planted on hoed land in Minecraft. Under the right conditions, the seeds will grow into a melon block.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Melon Seeds.
raw-beef: Raw beef in Minecraft is dropped when a cow is killed. It can be cooked in a furnace to create steak, which is a food item.
steak: Cooked beef, or steak, in Minecraft is the item that is obtained when raw beef is cooked in a furnace. It can be used to restore hunger levels.
raw-chicken: Raw chicken in Minecraft is dropped when a chicken is killed. It can be cooked in a furnace to create cooked chicken, which is a food item.
cooked-chicken: Cooked chicken in Minecraft is the item that is obtained when raw chicken is cooked in a furnace. It can be used to restore hunger levels.
rotten-flesh: Rotten flesh in Minecraft is a 'food item' that is dropped by zombies. Rotten flesh causes food poisoning for 30 seconds when consumed. It can also be used to tame wolves and trade with villagers.
ender-pearl: Enderpearls are dropped by endermen when they are killed. When right clicked, the will be thrown as a projectile and teleport you to the location at which they land.
blaze-rod: Blaze rods are dropped by blazes, which can be found in the nether. They can be used to create blaze powder, brewing stands and end rods.
ghast-tear: Ghast tears are dropped by ghasts when they are killed. They are a brewing ingredient and required to craft the end crystal.
gold-nugget: Golden nuggets can be made by placing a gold ingot in the crafting bench. They are used to create glistering melons for brewing, and many other items in Minecraft.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Gold Nugget.
nether-wart: Below is a table of the tools that can be used to break Nether Wart blocks, and the speed it will take to break at (in seconds). This is calculated with the formula (1.5 * Block Hardness) / Tool Multiplier.
Nether warts can be farmed, and also used as a brewing and crafting ingredient. Unlike most farming product, they can only be grown on soul sand. They are used to make awkward potions.
Block states are values assigned to a block that changes its state. For example, many blocks have a "direction" block state which can be used to change the direction a block faces.
Find a table of all blockstates for the Nether Wart block below.
potion: This is the default item that is used for potions in Minecraft. Potions can be consumed to give potion effects, both good and bad.
splash-potion: This is the default item that is used for splash potions in Minecraft. Splash potions will give people who are nearby to their impact when thrown a potion effect (relative to the splash potion type).
lingering-potion: Lingering potions can be used to leave a potion effect that 'lingers' on the ground for a longer period of time that a potion like a splash potion would.
awkward-potion: An awkward potion can be made using nether warts. It is used in the brewing recipes of many other potions, but has no other use outside of this.
thick-potion: A thick potion can be made with glowstone dust. It does not have any use in Minecraft as-of currently.
mundane-potion: A mundance potion can be made using many different items, including redstone, rabbits foot and many others. It currently doesn't have any use in Minecraft.
regeneration-potion-045: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the regeneration potion effect will be applied for 45 seconds. The regeneration potion effect decreases the time it takes for your health to restore.
swiftness-potion-300: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the swiftness potion effect will be applied for 3 minutes. The swiftness potion effect increases your speed and makes you run/walk faster than normal.
fire-resistance-potion-300: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the fire resistance potion effect will be applied for 3 minutes. The fire resistance potion effect will prevent you from taking damage from flames and fire.
poison-potion-045: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the poison potion effect will be applied for 45 seconds. The poison potion effect causes damage every second until it expires.. who would want to drink this?!
healing-potion: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), some of your health will be restored. This potion applies the instant health effect, restoring 4 health points (2 hearts).
night-vision-potion-300: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the night vision potion effect will be applied for 3 minutes. The night vision potion effect will allow you to see in the dark (so you do not need to place any light sources).
weakness-potion-130: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the weakness potion effect will be applied for 1 minute and 30 seconds. The weakness potion effect decreases your damage output and increases the amount of damage your take from all attacks.
strength-potion-300: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the strength effect will be applied for 3 minutes. The strength potion effect increases the amount of damage you deal to mobs, players and other entities.
slowness-potion-130: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the slowness will be applied for 1 minute and 30 seconds. The slowness potion effect is the exact opposite of the swiftness potion effect, and reduces the speed at which you can walk and run.
harming-potion: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), your character will take damage. The potion will give you the instant damage potion effect, which causes you to take 6 points (3 hearts) of damage.
water-breathing-potion-300: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the water breathing potion effect will be applied for 3 minutes. The water breathing potion effect allows you to 'breath underwater'. This means you won't take any damage from lack of breath whilst underwater whilst the potion effect is still active.
invisibility-potion-300: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the invisibility potion effect will be applied for 3 minutes. The invisibility potion effect, as the name would suggest, makes you invisible.
regeneration-potion-ii-022: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the regeneration 2 potion effect will be applied for 22 seconds. The regeneration potion effect decreases the time it takes for your health to restore.
swiftness-potion-ii-130: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the swiftness (speed) 2 potion effect will be applied for 1 minute and 30 seconds. The swiftness potion effect increases your speed and makes you run/walk faster than normal.
poison-potion-ii-022: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the poison 2 potion effect will be applied for 22 seconds. The poison potion effect causes damage every second until it expires.
healing-potion-ii: When the healing 2 potion is consumed (via holding right click), some of your health will be restored. This potion applies the instant health effect 2, restoring 8 health points (4 hearts).
strength-potion-ii-130: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the strength 2 potion effect will be applied for 1 minute and 30 seconds. The strength potion effect increases the amount of damage you deal to mobs, players and other entities.
leaping-potion-ii-130: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the leaping 2 potion effect will be applied for 1 minute and 30 seconds. The leaping potion effect makes your character jump higher than it can normally.
harming-potion-ii: When harming potion 2 is consumed (via holding right click), your character will take damage. The potion will give you the instant damage 2 potion effect, which causes you to take 12 points (6 hearts) of damage.
regeneration-potion-200: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the regeneration potion effect will be applied for 2 minutes. The regeneration potion effect decreases the time it takes for your health to restore.
swiftness-potion-800: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the swiftness potion effect will be applied for 8 minutes. The swiftness potion effect increases your speed and makes you run/walk faster than normal.
fire-resistance-potion-800: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the fire resistance potion effect will be applied for 8 minutes. The fire resistance potion effect will prevent you from taking damage from flames and fire.
poison-potion-200: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the poison potion effect will be applied for 2 minutes. The poison potion effect causes damage every second until it expires.. who would want to drink this?!
night-vision-potion-800: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the night vision potion effect will be applied for 8 minutes. The night vision potion effect will allow you to see in the dark (so you do not need to place any light sources).
weakness-potion-400: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the weakness potion effect will be applied for 4 minutes. The weakness potion effect decreases your damage output and increases the amount of damage your take from all attacks.
strength-potion-800: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the strength effect will be applied for 8 minutes. The strength potion effect increases the amount of damage you deal to mobs, players and other entities.
slowness-potion-400: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the slowness will be applied for 4 minutes. The slowness potion effect is the exact opposite of the swiftness potion effect, and reduces the speed at which you can walk and run.
leaping-potion-300: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the jump boost potion effect will be applied for 3 minutes. The leaping potion effect makes your character jump higher than it can normally.
water-breathing-potion-800: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the water breathing potion effect will be applied for 8 minutes. The water breathing potion effect allows you to 'breath underwater'. This means you won't take any damage from lack of breath when underwater and the potion effect is active.
invisibility-potion-800: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the invisibility potion effect will be applied for 8 minutes. The invisibility potion effect, as the name would suggest, makes you invisible.
regeneration-potion-ii-100: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the regeneration 2 potion effect will be applied for 1 minute. The regeneration potion effect decreases the time it takes for your health to restore.
swiftness-potion-ii-400: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the swiftness (speed) 2 potion effect will be applied for 4 minutes. The swiftness potion effect increases your speed and makes you run/walk faster than normal.
poison-potion-ii-100: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the poison 2 potion effect will be applied for 1 minute. The poison potion effect causes damage every second until it expires.
strength-potion-ii-400: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the strength 2 potion effect will be applied for 4 minutes. The strength potion effect increases the amount of damage you deal to mobs, players and other entities.
potion-of-the-turtle-master-020: This potion gives you the Turtle Master potion effect for 20 seconds. The Turtle Master potion effect gives you Slowness IV and Resistance III.
potion-of-the-turtle-master-040: This potion gives you the Turtle Master potion effect for 40 seconds. The Turtle Master potion effect gives you Slowness IV and Resistance III.
potion-of-the-turtle-master-ii-020: This potion gives you the Turtle Master II potion effect for 20 seconds. The Turtle Master II potion effect gives you Slowness VI and Resistance IV.
potion-of-slow-falling-130: After consuming this potion, you will be given the Slow Falling potion effect for 1 minute 30 seconds, which, as you might have already guessed, makes you fall slowly (as-if gravity has a lesser effect). You will also not take fall damage and be unable to break crops by jumping on them.
potion-of-slow-falling-400: After consuming this potion, you will be given the Slow Falling potion effect for 4 minutes, which, as you might have already guessed, makes you fall slowly (as-if gravity has a lesser effect). You will also not take fall damage and be unable to break crops by jumping on them.

book-and-quill: The book and quill in Minecraft can be used to write a book. To write inside, right click the book and a book interface will open. You must sign the book to save the contents.

written-book: The written book is obtained when book and quill is signed. The written book can be right clicked to open a book interface with the content of the signed book inside.

item-frame: Item frames in Minecraft can be used to.. frame items. They can be made using 1 leather item and 8 sticks. To put an item in an item frame, right click the item frame with the item you want to frame in your hand.

carrot: Carrots in Minecraft are foods item that can also be farmed. To plant a carrot, right click hoed dirt with the carrot item. To consume a carrot, hold right click with a carrot in your hand.
potato: Potatoes in Minecraft are a food item that can also be farmed. To plant a potato, right click hoed dirt with the carrot item. To consume a potato, hold right click with a carrot in your hand.
baked-potato: A baked potato can be made by putting a potato, with fuel, in a furnace. It restores more hunger than a regular potato, and cannot be planted.
poisonous-potato: Poisonous potatoes have a 1 in 50 chance of being dropped when a potato is farmed. They have a 60% chance of giving the poison potion effect when eaten, and cannot be replanted.
empty-map: Maps (empty) in Minecraft can be used to get a birds eye view of the world and find your way about. They can be made using 9 paper.

This block is a decorative skull in Minecraft that represents the head of a human or player. It can be assigned meta data to display the skin head of an actual username.

Find a table of all blockstates for the Zombie Head block below.
This block is a decorative skull in Minecraft that represents the head of a zombie.

Find a table of all blockstates for the Creeper Head block below.
This block is a decorative skull in Minecraft that represents the head of a creeper.
dragon-head: Block states are values assigned to a block that changes its state. For example, many blocks have a "direction" block state which can be used to change the direction a block faces.
Find a table of all blockstates for the Dragon Head block below.
This block is a decorative skull in Minecraft that represents the head of an enderdragon.
carrot-on-a-stick: This item can be used to lure pigs in Minecraft. It can be made by placing a carrot and a fishing rod in the crafting table.. creative, huh?
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Carrot on a Stick.
nether-star: Nether stars are required to make beacons and are dropped by the wither boss from the nether in Minecraft.
pumpkin-pie: Pumpkin pies are a food item that can be made with a pumpkin, 1 sugar and 1 egg. To consume the pumpkin pie, hold right click whilst the item is in your hand.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Pumpkin Pie.
firework-rocket: Fireworks can be customized to make extravagant particle explosions in the game. This is the base item that is required to make them!
firework-star: Firework stars are made with dyes and gunpowder! A firework charge is the item that is used to customize the size, effect and color of a firework.
enchanted-book: Enchanted books in Minecraft are used to apply enchantments to items, without the need for an enchantment table. They cannot be crafted, but can be found in dungeons. An anvil is require to apply the enchantment specified by the book to an item.
nether-brick: Netherbricks can be made by smelting netherrack, with a fuel, in a furnace in Minecraft. They are used to create decorative blocks like the nether brick block.
nether-quartz: Quartz can be obtained from quartz ore in the nether. It is used to create daylight sensors, along with other decorative blocks and redstone utilities.
minecart-with-tnt: Minecarts with TNT are, as the name would suggest, minecarts with TNT inside. They cannot take a passenger. They can obviously be.. DETONATED!
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Minecart with TNT.
minecart-with-hopper: Minecarts with hoppers are, as the name would suggest, minecarts with hoppers. They cannot take a passenger. When right clicked, they open up the hopper interface.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Minecart with Hopper.
prismarine-shard: Prismarine shards are dropped by guardians and elder guardians. They can be used to create decorative prismarine blocks.
prismarine-crystals: Prismarine Crystals are dropped by guardians and elder guardians. They can be used to create decorative prismarine blocks.
raw-rabbit: Raw rabbit in Minecraft is dropped when a rabbit is killed. It can be cooked in a furnace to create cooked rabbit, which is a food item.
cooked-rabbit: Cooked rabbit in Minecraft is the item that is obtained when raw rabbit is cooked in a furnace. It can be used to restore hunger levels.
rabbit-stew: Rabbit stew is a food item that can be consumed to restore hunger. It is made using a bowl, mushroom, carrot, potato and of course.. a cooked rabbit.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Rabbit Stew.
rabbits-foot: A rabbit foot has a 1 in 10 chance of being dropped when a rabbit is killed. It is used as a brewing ingredient and cannot be consumed.. who would want to eat a rabbit's foot?!
rabbit-hide: Rabbit hide is dropped by a rabbit on death. 4 rabbit hides can be used to create leather.
armor-stand: An armor stand can be used to display and/or store armour. To put a piece of armour on an armor stand, right click the armor stand with the item in your hand.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Armor Stand.
iron-horse-armor: Horse armor acts exactly like regular armor for players, but can be equipped by horses and provides them with extra defence.
golden-horse-armor: Gold horse armor acts exactly like regular armor for players, but can be equipped by horses and provides them with extra defence.
diamond-horse-armor: Horse armor acts exactly like regular armor for players, but can be equipped by horses and provides them with extra defence.
lead: A lead can be attached to animals like horses and pigs to both move them about and fix them to fences so that they cannot run away.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Lead.
name-tag: A name tag can be used to name a mob in Minecraft. Right click the mob with a name tag to set its name.
minecart-with-command-block: Minecarts with command blocks are, as the name would suggest, minecarts with command blocks inside. They cannot take a passenger.
raw-mutton: Raw mutton in Minecraft is dropped when a sheep is killed. It can be cooked in a furnace to create cooked mutton, which is a food item.
cooked-mutton: Cooked mutton in Minecraft is the item that is obtained when raw mutton is cooked in a furnace. It can be used to restore hunger levels.

end-crystal: This is the block that represents the crystals that spawn on the top of columns in the end.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make End Crystal.
chorus-fruit: Chorus fruit can be both consumed, and cooked. When eaten, it will restore 4 hunger. It can be obtained from chorus plants, which grow naturally only in the end.
popped-chorus-fruit: Popper chorus fruit can be made by cooking chorus fruit. It is used as a crafting ingredient. It cannot be eaten.
beetroot: Beetroot is a food item that can be consumed to satiate your hunger. It can also be used to breed and lure pigs.
beetroot-seeds: Beetroot seeds are a farming item used to.. grow beetroot. To plant beetroot seeds, right click them on hoed dirt. Given the right lighting conditions and nearby water, they will grow into beetroot.
beetroot-soup: Beetroot soup can be made using a bowl, a mushroom and a beetroot. It is a food item that can be consumed to satiate your hunger levels.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Beetroot Soup.
dragons-breath: The dragon's breath item can only be obtained by using an empty glass bottle around the ender dragon's breath attack. It can be used in the brewing of lingering potions.
spectral-arrow: When a spectral arrow hits a target, it creates an outline around the entity. This is useful as it provides an x-ray (in a sense), so that you do not lose your target.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Spectral Arrow.
tipped-arrow: Tipped arrows inflict a potion effect when they hit their target. There are many different arrows, each having an individual potion effect such as strength or poison.
shield: A shield in Minecraft can be crafted using 6 wooden planks and 1 iron ingot. It can be equipped in your off-hand to provide extra defence.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Shield.
elytra: An elytra allows you to glide and fly in Minecraft. They are found only in end cities, and cannot be crafted. It is equipped in the chestplate armor slot.
spruce-boat: Spruce boats are useful as they allow fast transport across water. They can be made with 5 spruce planks, and put on water by right click.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Spruce Boat.
birch-boat: Birch boats are useful as they allow fast transport across water. They can be made with 5 birch planks, and put on water by right click.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Birch Boat.
jungle-boat: Jungle boats are useful as they allow fast transport across water. They can be made with 5 jungle planks, and put on water by right click.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Jungle Boat.
acacia-boat: Acacia boats are useful as they allow fast transport across water. They can be made with 5 acacia planks, and put on water by right click.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Acacia Boat.
dark-oak-boat: Dark oak boats are useful as they allow fast transport across water. They can be made with 5 dark oak planks, and put on water by right click.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Dark Oak Boat.
totem-of-undying: The totem of undying item is dropped by evokers in Minecraft. It will save a player from death if it is equipped when they die.
shulker-shell: The shulker shell is used to create shulker boxes (along with a chest) in Minecraft. It is dropped by.. shulkers!
iron-nugget: Iron nuggets can be made by placing an iron ingot in the crafting table in Minecraft. They have little to no use currently.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Iron Nugget.
knowledge-book: This item can only be spawned in using its spawn commands that are found on this page. This book can be used to unlock crafting recipes (if they are locked, for example by the doLimitedCrafting gamerule).
debug-stick: This item can be spawned in using its spawn commands that are found on this page. It can be used to edit block states - simply hit a block with it to cycle through blockstates, shifting and hitting a block will cycle through blockstates in reverse order.
13-disc: This music dic plays record '13'. Music discs can be found in dungeons in Vanilla Minecraft. When right clicked on a jukebox, the track of the music disc, or record, plays.

wait-disc: This music dic plays record 'wait'. Music discs can be found in dungeons in Vanilla Minecraft. When right clicked on a jukebox, the track of the music disc, or record, plays.
trident: The trident is dropped by drowneds and can be picked up if thrown. It can be used as both a melee weapon and ranged (by throwing it). It can be thrown by holding right click until fully charged.
phantom-membrane: The phantom membrane is sometimes dropped by phantoms when they are killed. It can be used to repair the elytra and as a brewing ingredient in the slow falling potion
nautilus-shell: The only use of this item currently is in the crafting recipe of conduits. They can be obtained via fishing and rarely, by drowneds.
heart-of-the-sea: This item cannot be crafted, it can only be found within buried treasure chests. It can be used to craft a conduit by placing it in the center of a crafting bench surrounded by 8 nautilus shells.
water: Block states are values assigned to a block that changes its state. For example, many blocks have a "direction" block state which can be used to change the direction a block faces.

A piston head is no obtainable in Vanilla Minecraft. It is the block that is pushed outwards from a regular piston when it is activated.

Find a table of all blockstates for the Moving Piston block below.
The piston extension block is not obtainable in vanilla Minecraft. It is a block added in Minecraft 1.13, but is invisible, cannot be broken easily (you have to use commands/TNT) and is not solid.

Fire is the block that takes the place of fire in Minecraft. Whilst this block cannot be spawned into your inventory in Minecraft, it is created when you right click with a flint and steel on the ground, or in other situations like when blaze shoots.

Redstone wire is the block that is created when redstone is right clicked on the ground. It cannot be crafted or obtained in Vanilla Minecraft as an item. Its primary function is to carry redstone current.

This is an unobtainable item (it cannot be inside your inventory). It takes the place of a redstone torch when you place it on a wall.
nether-portal: Block states are values assigned to a block that changes its state. For example, many blocks have a "direction" block state which can be used to change the direction a block faces.

The portal block is created when a nether portal is formed in Minecraft. When stood in for 3 seconds, a user is teleported to the nether. This block cannot be obtained as an item in Vanilla Minecraft. It is commonly used on Minecraft server hubs as a portal.

end-portal: The end portal block cannot be obtained in Vanilla Minecraft but is used by Minecraft to display the 'end portal effect'. It also is useful as a light source in Minecraft builds as it cannot be seen when looked at from below. The end portal block can be spawned in using WorldEdit (as it cannot be obtained as an inventory item). The item image shown below is the incorrect image. This item is the end portal block, not the nether portal block.

creeper-spawner: This is the item ID for a creeper spawner which is a mob spawner. Mob spawners, or monster spawners, are blocks that spawn mobs when placed. Conditions (e.g. light levels) relative to the mob type of the spawner must still be met in order for the monster to spawn. bee-spawn-egg: As the name suggests, the Bee Spawn Egg will spawn a bee when you hold the item in your hand and right click a block. Bees are naturally non-aggressive mobs that won't attack unless provoked. When provoked (i.e. if you hit them), they will attempt to sting, and if successful, poison you. Bees are also crucial to bee hives.
honeycomb: The Honeycomb item was brought along in Minecraft 1.15 and can be harvested from both bee hives and bee nests. To obtain this item (without spawn commands) you will have to shear a hive or nest which can result in the inhabitants (bees!) attacking.
bee-nest: Below is a table of the tools that can be used to break Bee Nest blocks, and the speed it will take to break at (in seconds). This is calculated with the formula (1.5 * Block Hardness) / Tool Multiplier.

Bees nests naturally spawn on trees and house a colony of bees. They can be used to obtain honeycombs. Trees in Plains and Sunflower Plains biomes are much more likely to house a bees nest, but as these have low amounts of trees, your best chance of *encountering* a bee nest is within the Flower Forest biome (within which, 1 in every 50 trees will be home to a bees nest).
Block states are values assigned to a block that changes its state. For example, many blocks have a "direction" block state which can be used to change the direction a block faces.
Find a table of all blockstates for the Bee Nest block below.

Bee hives are similar to bees nests in that they house bees, but they do not spawn naturally and must be crafted. Bees who are pollinated will naturally fly into bee hives and start to produce honeycombs. Once ready, these honeycombs can be harvested by using sheers on the block. The crafting recipe for bee hives can be found on this page and requires both planks and honeycombs.
Below you can find the crafting recipes that can be used to make Beehive.

honeycomb-block: Honeycomb blocks are blocks made from 4 honeycombs. Having no function, these blocks are currently only decorational. You cannot convert these blocks back into their original crafting ingredients (in the same way that you would with a diamond block).

crimson-fungus: Crimson fungus is effectively the Nether's version of a mushroom (along with warped fungus). It can be found within the crimson and warped forest biomes, but you are more likely to find this variant in the crimson forest.
warped-fungus: Warped fungus is effectively the Nether's version of a mushroom (along with crimson fungus). It can be found within the crimson and warped forest biomes, but you are more likely to find this variant in the warped forest.
crimson-roots: Crimson roots are native to the Nether and spawn within the crimson forest biome (and in rare cases, the warped forest or soul sand valley biomes). It is mainly a decorative block but can be placed in a composter.
warped-roots: Warped roots are native to the Nether and spawn within the warped forest biome (and in rare cases, the crimson forest or soul sand valley biomes). It is mainly a decorative block but can be placed in a composter.

netherite-scrap: Netherite scraps can be obtained by smelting ancient debris. They are used to created netherite ingots. Naturally, they may spawn within treasure chests, generic chests, and hoglin stable chests within Bastion remnants.
netherite-sword: The netherite sword is the best melee weapon in the game and can be made by placing a netherite ingot into a smithing table along with a diamond sword.
netherite-shovel: The netherite shovel is the best shovel in the game and can be made by placing a netherite ingot into a smithing table along with a diamond shovel.
netherite-pickaxe: The netherite pickaxe is the best pickaxe in the game and can be made by placing a netherite ingot into a smithing table along with a diamond pickaxe.

netherite-hoe: The netherite hoe is the best hoe in the game and can be made by placing a netherite ingot into a smithing table along with a diamond hoe.
netherite-helmet: Requiring a diamond helmet and a netherite ingot to be paired together in a smithing table, the netherite helmet is currently the best helmet in the game.
netherite-chestplate: Requiring a diamond chestplate and a netherite ingot to be paired together in a smithing table, the netherite chestplate is currently the best body armor in the game.
netherite-leggings: Requiring diamond leggings and a netherite ingot to be paired together in a smithing table, netherite leggings are currently the best leg armor in the game.
netherite-boots: Requiring diamond boots and a netherite ingot to be paired together in a smithing table, netherite boots are currently the best defence item for the foot slot in the game.

strider-spawn-egg: Strider spawn eggs are items used to spawn Striders. They can be activated by right clicking on a block with the spawn egg in your character's hand. Striders are mobs that usually only spawn in the Nether. Water and rain will harm Striders. They are passive mobs.
zoglin-spawn-egg: When right clicked on a block, this item will spawn a zoglin mob. A zoglin is created when a regular hoglin enters a world other than the Nether (and stays there for more than 15 seconds). They are extremely aggressive mobs.
